metadata.title: CVE-2019-19054 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak in the cx23888_ir_probe() function indrivers/media/pci/cx23885/cx23888-ir.c in the Linux kernel through 5.3.11allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) bytriggering kfifo_alloc() failures, aka CID-a7b2df76b42b.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19054` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1078-aws - 4.4.0-1078.82
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1096-azure - 4.15.0-1096.106~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1078.82').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1096.106~14.04.1').
